page.title: 03ARTS & CRAFT
page.content: There are two full-time craftsmen, one in L. Dayrell who makes wrought iron pieces, another in Akeley who creates one-off' machines. At home all kinds of crafts are produced: women knit, sew, make patchwork, lace, paint etc. Most men become adept in do-it-your- self', a way of improving home and garden, attempting skilled jobs, such as bricklaying and plumbing. Children are taught to be creative and produce things' from egg boxes and scraps. They are encouraged to enjoy this with- out worry about mess. Mothers are often required to dress their offspring as witches, goblins, fairies, trees, rabbits, depending on current school drama and they rise to the challenge.
